How does a CTG work? 
• CTGs are an indirect measure of several aspects of fetal health, including central nervous system function, fetal
oxygenation, autonomic control of heart rate, fetal movements and sleep-wake cycles.
o These are all influenced by the condition of the baby and its in-utero environment.
• When the baby has limited reserve, he or she may become hypoxic during uterine contractions.
